text: to create a new API click on the orange
create API button in the AWS app sync
dashboard next we'll be given the option
to either create an API from scratch or
use a pre-configured example application
we'll choose author from scratch because
we'd like to start with a brand new
blank schema
next we'll give the API name and click
the orange create button
once the API has been created we'll be
given some information about the API
including the API URL the API ID in the
API key
and the left-hand menu click on schema
so we can go ahead and create our graph
QL schema
in the scheme of you we can either
create our schema from scratch or we can
use the create resources flow which will
automatically generate our schema our
resolvers as well as our data sources
based on a single type for this example
let's go ahead and click on the create
resources button here we can either
define a new type or use an existing
type that's been defined in our schema
for our example we'll go ahead and
create a new type of to do the two new
type we'll have an idea body a title of
string and a completed of boolean
if we scroll down we'll see that some
additional schema is going to be created
for us
we can see that will have three
mutations three subscriptions and two
queries that are automatically created
for us
next go ahead and scroll to the bottom
of the page and click create
once the resource creation is complete
we'll see that the automatically
generated schema has been added to our
schema view
next let's go ahead and click on data
sources in the left-hand menu to view
the data source that was created for us
here we see that a dynamo DB table of to
do table has been created to view the
table we can click on the resource name
here we can view the table information
as well as any items that have been
added to the table
